00007 #include "Notifier.h"
00008 #include "Synchronized.h"
00009 #include "Timer.h"
00010 #include "Utility.h"
00011 #include "WPIStatus.h"

00013 const UINT32 Notifier::kTimerInterruptNumber;
00014 Notifier *Notifier::timerQueueHead = NULL;
00015 SEM_ID Notifier::queueSemaphore = NULL;
00016 tAlarm *Notifier::talarm = NULL;
00017 tInterruptManager *Notifier::manager = NULL;
00018 int Notifier::refcount = 0;
00019 
00025 Notifier::Notifier(TimerEventHandler handler, void *param)
00026 {
00027     tRioStatusCode status = 0;
00028     wpi_assert(handler != NULL);
00029     m_handler = handler;
00030     m_param = param;
00031     m_periodic = false;
00032     m_expirationTime = 0;
00033     m_period = 0;
00034     m_nextEvent = NULL;
00035     m_queued = false;
00036     m_handlerSemaphore = semBCreate(SEM_Q_PRIORITY, SEM_FULL);
00037     if (queueSemaphore == NULL)
00038     {
00039         queueSemaphore = semBCreate(SEM_Q_PRIORITY, SEM_FULL);
00040     }
00041     {
00042         Synchronized sync(queueSemaphore);
00043         // do the first time intialization of static variables
00044         if (refcount == 0)
00045         {
00046             manager = new tInterruptManager(1 << kTimerInterruptNumber, false, &status);
00047             manager->registerHandler(ProcessQueue, NULL, &status);
00048             manager->enable(&status);
00049             talarm = new tAlarm(&status);
00050         }
00051         refcount++;
00052     }
00053     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00054 }
00055 
00061 Notifier::~Notifier()
00062 {
00063     {
00064         Synchronized sync(queueSemaphore);
00065         DeleteFromQueue();
00066 
00067         // Delete the static variables when the last one is going away
00068         if (!(--refcount))
00069         {
00070             tRioStatusCode status = 0;
00071             talarm->writeEnable(false, &status);
00072             delete talarm;
00073             talarm = NULL;
00074             manager->disable(&status);
00075             delete manager;
00076             manager = NULL;
00077             wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00078         }
00079     }
00080 
00081     // Acquire the semaphore; this makes certain that the handler is 
00082     // not being executed by the interrupt manager.
00083     semTake(m_handlerSemaphore, WAIT_FOREVER);
00084     // Delete while holding the semaphore so there can be no race.
00085     semDelete(m_handlerSemaphore);
00086 }
00087 
00095 void Notifier::UpdateAlarm()
00096 {
00097     tRioStatusCode status = 0;
00098     if (timerQueueHead != NULL)
00099     {
00100         // write the first item in the queue into the trigger time
00101         talarm->writeTriggerTime((UINT32)(timerQueueHead->m_expirationTime * 1e6), &status);
00102         // Enable the alarm.  The hardware disables itself after each alarm.
00103         talarm->writeEnable(true, &status);
00104     }
00105     wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00106 }
00107 
00114 void Notifier::ProcessQueue(tNIRIO_u32 mask, void *params)
00115 {
00116     Notifier *current;
00117     while (true)                // keep processing past events until no more
00118     {
00119         {
00120             Synchronized sync(queueSemaphore);
00121             double currentTime = GetClock();
00122             current = timerQueueHead;
00123             if (current == NULL || current->m_expirationTime > currentTime)
00124             {
00125                 break;      // no more timer events to process
00126             }
00127             // need to process this entry
00128             timerQueueHead = current->m_nextEvent;
00129             if (current->m_periodic)
00130             {
00131                 // if periodic, requeue the event
00132                 // compute when to put into queue
00133                 current->InsertInQueue(true);
00134             }
00135             else
00136             {
00137                 // not periodic; removed from queue
00138                 current->m_queued = false;
00139             }
00140             // Take handler semaphore while holding queue semaphore to make sure
00141             //  the handler will execute to completion in case we are being deleted.
00142             semTake(current->m_handlerSemaphore, WAIT_FOREVER);
00143         }
00144 
00145         current->m_handler(current->m_param);   // call the event handler
00146         semGive(current->m_handlerSemaphore);
00147     }
00148     // reschedule the first item in the queue
00149     Synchronized sync(queueSemaphore);
00150     UpdateAlarm();
00151 }
00152 
00162 void Notifier::InsertInQueue(bool reschedule)
00163 {
00164     tRioStatusCode status = 0;
00165     if (reschedule)
00166     {
00167         m_expirationTime += m_period;
00168     }
00169     else
00170     {
00171         m_expirationTime = GetClock() + m_period;
00172     }
00173     if (timerQueueHead == NULL || timerQueueHead->m_expirationTime >= this->m_expirationTime)
00174     {
00175         // the queue is empty or greater than the new entry
00176         // the new entry becomes the first element
00177         this->m_nextEvent = timerQueueHead;
00178         timerQueueHead = this;
00179         if (!reschedule)
00180         {
00181             // since the first element changed, update alarm, unless we already plan to
00182             UpdateAlarm();
00183         }
00184         wpi_assertCleanStatus(status);
00185     }
00186     else
00187     {
00188         for (Notifier **npp = &(timerQueueHead->m_nextEvent); ; npp = &(*npp)->m_nextEvent)
00189         {
00190             Notifier *n = *npp;
00191             if (n == NULL || n->m_expirationTime > this->m_expirationTime)
00192             {
00193                 *npp = this;
00194                 this->m_nextEvent = n;
00195                 break;
00196             }
00197         }
00198     }
00199     m_queued = true;
00200 }
00201 
00209 void Notifier::DeleteFromQueue()
00210 {
00211     if (m_queued)
00212     {
00213         m_queued = false;
00214         wpi_assert(timerQueueHead != NULL);
00215         if (timerQueueHead == this)
00216         {
00217             // remove the first item in the list - update the alarm
00218             timerQueueHead = this->m_nextEvent;
00219             UpdateAlarm();
00220         }
00221         else
00222         {
00223             for (Notifier *n = timerQueueHead; n != NULL; n = n->m_nextEvent)
00224             {
00225                 if (n->m_nextEvent == this)
00226                 {
00227                     // this element is the next element from *n from the queue
00228                     n->m_nextEvent = this->m_nextEvent; // point around this one
00229                 }
00230             }
00231         }
00232     }
00233 }
00234 
00240 void Notifier::StartSingle(double delay)
00241 {
00242     Synchronized sync(queueSemaphore);
00243     m_periodic = false;
00244     m_period = delay;
00245     DeleteFromQueue();
00246     InsertInQueue(false);
00247 }
00248 
00255 void Notifier::StartPeriodic(double period)
00256 {
00257     Synchronized sync(queueSemaphore);
00258     m_periodic = true;
00259     m_period = period;
00260     DeleteFromQueue();
00261     InsertInQueue(false);
00262 }
00263 
00271 void Notifier::Stop()
00272 {
00273     {
00274         Synchronized sync(queueSemaphore);
00275         DeleteFromQueue();
00276     }
00277     // Wait for a currently executing handler to complete before returning from Stop()
00278     Synchronized sync(m_handlerSemaphore);
00279 }
